results.title: (Junior) QA Software Tester
results.description:
🚀 Who are we?

At Grip, we’re passionate about bringing professionals together to move markets forward faster. Our leading Platform for Event Organisers enables our clients to create Live, Virtual, and Hybrid event experiences in a single solution. Making it easier for event participants to connect, engage and do business.

 

Grip works with 12 out of 20 of the largest Event Organisers globally and is known for its leading AI-powered matchmaking engine, used to establish millions of valuable connections at thousands of events. As a multi-award-winning global leader in AI-powered tech, we pride ourselves on being real innovators in the event tech space.

 

Grip recently completed a $13M Series A funding round led by Kennet Partners, a well-known London-based VC Fund. Other investors at Grip include leading entrepreneurs Brent Hoberman (CEO and Founder at Lastminute.com, Made.com, Founders Factory), Arnaud Massenet (Co-Founder at Net-a-Porter), and Jeremy Roche (FinancialForce, Unit4).

 

 

🚀 Expectation of the role:

As a QA Software Tester, you will be responsible for ensuring that the quality of Grip’s software offering is maintained at the highest level for our clients and event attendees.

 

 

The role will involve working closely with colleagues in Engineering and Business teams to test the various software features used in a wide variety of professional events both in-person and online.

🚀 Responsibilities:

  • Create test plans alongside product development for Grip’s web and API offerings
  • Work with our Customer Success Team to diagnose user reports, feedback and bugs and feed the needed developments into the technical team together with the Product Manager
  • Execute and maintain test plans as part of product delivery. Plans should be reproducible and auditable
  • Create test plans for client-specific features and liaise with internal stakeholders about the client’s requirements on features pre and post-development
  • Plan, execute and monitor the inspection and testing of the incoming and outgoing product features to confirm quality conformance to specs and acceptance criteria

 

🚀 Experience and Skills:

  • Strong verbal and written communications skills with the unique ability to communicate complicated topics clearly to technical and non-technical team members
  • Ability to understand issues quickly, think logically and break down requirements into testable units

Bonus points:

  • Technical first degree or equivalent practical experience in software testing
  • Experience in both: functional and non-functional testing
  • Experience in using test management tools
  • Experience in using tools such as Cypress, Selenium, Qase

 

🚀 Grip Serbia Benefits:

  • Remote working possibilities (also post COVID-19)
  • Private Health Insurance
  • Company Training Sponsorship Programme
  • Enhanced and Inclusive Paid Parental Leave
  • 25 holiday days per annum
  • Opportunity to take lead in shaping an entire industry through AI
  • A world-class team of sales, marketing, operations and engineering
  • Rare opportunity to grow with the company and take the lead in shaping an entire industry’s use of technology
  • Kind, fun and ambitious company culture

results.title: Finance Manager
results.description:
We’re looking for an experienced, hands-on finance manager to help us build and scale Nillion’s finance function, globally. Nillion brings to life fast, permissionless, decentralized computation. We have just closed our strategic fundraise, with an oversubscribed round of $20 million. The technology fundamentally changes how data is stored, processed, and decentralized and opens up a realm of alternative decentralized use cases.

As a Finance Manager at Nillion, you will assist with treasury management, accounting and financial operations while helping us build and scale internal processes and compliance systems. A key aspect of this role is to help build a solid audit-proof financial structure, while keeping it agile and scalable. The role will report to the Director of Finance.

If you’re the kind of person who, maybe, had a calculator watch at some point, if you enjoy being part of a fast-paced, remote, finance team and like being surrounded by inspiring co-workers, then keep reading!

 

Role and Responsibilities:

  • Manage procurement, accounts payable process and treasury
  • Manage the company group tax and compliance activities
  • Prepare the company group accounting and related activities
  • Control employee payroll/wages process
  • Own the intercompany payment and billing process
  • Prepare monthly group reporting and consolidation
  • Support with the company's budget preparation and control
  • Assist with the preparation and monitoring of annual budget and periodic forecasts
  • Support the preparation of the annual and monthly financial planning
  • Support the preparation of the annual Statutory and Direct tax reporting
  • Support the external tax advisors in the preparation of tax files
  • Identify potential financial risks and opportunities and present them in a timely manner
  • Acting as business partner and liaison for Legal, People, and other departments as needed

Requirements

  • Degree in Finance, Accounting, or similar
  • 4+ years of professional experience working in a similar role
  • Excellent interpersonal communication skills; people-first approach
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment
  • Ability to work cross-functionally with a globally distributed team
  • Good understanding of all areas of a financial department, including; accounting, treasury, and controlling
  • Demonstrated experience working in Startups or hyper growth organisation
  • Solid understanding of IFRS, US GAAP, and bridging
  • Working knowledge of indirect and direct taxes (EU/US)
  • Experience managing payroll and related accounting
  • Solid understanding of group consolidation reporting, multi-leder, and multi-currency accounting
  • Proven experience in international operations and environments
  • Excel wizard and experienced with different accounting softwares
  • Fluent in English

Nice to haves

  • Professional experience with Audit or Big4
  • Experience or knowledge with blockchain, crypto or Web 3

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and token Compensation; you will be eligible to acquire Nil tokens as part of your bonus
  • Make a big impact as a early contributor to an incredible founding team
  • Work on new problems in an incredible emerging and dynamic field
  • Learn from experts in a mentorship-oriented work culture
  • You don’t need to be in an office or at a desk to have an impact anymore! We are fully remote, but value regular meet-ups

If this sounds like it could be a good fit and you’d like to find out more, hit apply below and submit your CV! If you don’t have a CV to hand, you can always download your LinkedIn profile and use that (click “More…” on your LinkedIn profile then “Save to PDF” 💡).

results.title: Senior Artist - Studio Orbital
results.description:
We are looking for a talented senior artist who is an expert in 3D content creation. You would use your significant knowledge in games art to become the go-to person for different areas of the game’s development, including characters, creatures and organic lifeforms.

You will help mentor some amazing junior artists and will get to work collaboratively across the project to ensure amazing artwork is professionally presented and brought to life.

 

What Will You Be Doing?

  • Working with the art director to embody the artistic vision of the project.
  • Creating unique and varied content that captures charm and personality of our projects.
  • Constructing content from block-out to final in-game asset, whilst considering the framework, limitations, and design.
  • Mentoring and supporting junior members of the art team through reviews and feedback.
  • Verifying art in VR and making improvements where necessary to fit technical limitations and artistic direction.
  • Contributing to areas of the project such as plant life, creatures, products, customisations, and props.
  • Contributing to other areas of the project when possible - such as marketing artwork & 2D asset creation.

Requirements

Who Are We Looking For?

  • Experience of high and low polygon modelling, sculpting and a good knowledge of PBR material workflow via software packages such as Maya, Z-Brush, Substance, and Photoshop.
  • Knowledge of implementing art in Unreal or similar game engines.
  • Experience achieving simplistic artwork on more constrained devices (such as mobile), with an understanding of platform limitations, memory, and performance.
  • A good grasp of art and design fundamentals (including anatomy, texture, colour, and depth theories).
  • Working knowledge of industry standard project management tools and source control software.
  • A passion for video games, art, and commitment to personal development.
  • A creative thinker with strong problem-solving abilities.
  • Positive and outgoing personality with a can-do attitude and be able to adapt based on feedback.
  • A true team player, able to work collaboratively as a part of a multidiscipline team with the initiative, drive, and organisation skills to deliver excellent results on time.
  • Comfortable working in an Agile environment and responsive to change in the face of uncertainty.
  • Interest in the VR market and the latest gameplay innovations.

Benefits

Who we are

We are nDreams, an award-winning independent developer and publisher, delivering world-leading interactive VR experiences.

nDreams Studio Orbital is looking for talented people to help pioneer development in live service games for VR that will entertain players for years. This is an exciting opportunity to be at the heart of both a new team and project right from the start.

We are building a fully remote studio that holds creative diversity as a core value. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, perspectives, genders and experience levels to apply for this role.

Why nDreams?

Our growing studio shares a passion for innovation, collaboration and defining the future of VR. We encourage an open, creative, and diverse culture and empower people to explore their ideas and put their own stamp on projects. With humble beginnings of our own, we combine big projects and opportunities with a personal, caring touch. We’re proud of our culture – come and see why!

We offer some great perks, including flexible core hours, private health insurance, pension, two duvet days plus a day off to celebrate your birthday. As you’d guess, we provide all the equipment you need to create amazing VR experiences.

We are a remote first studio with the advantages that brings. We will hold social get togethers once per quarter in London to bond and become the best team we can be.

results.title: EDI Data Analyst
results.description:
EDI Data Analyst

Dynamic Healthcare Systems, a wholly owned subsidiary of Reveleer, is looking for an individual with Medicare EDI experience to join our team.  The EDI Data Analyst will support new and current EDI risk adjustment customers.  The Data Analyst will work directly with clients to assure timely, accurate, consistent, and complete submissions of encounter data.  Additionally, you will assist clients in mapping encounter data files to Dynamic standard formats, track inbound/outbound files sent by clients and processed in our proprietary software (Voyager), review errors received and document the errors with business friendly explanations, and assure optimal data integrity.  You will identify data issues or discrepancies between CMS rules and Voyager rules and report to the appropriate parties.  In this role, you will thoroughly analyze issues, identify the root cause, and work with the Integration team and Software Development team to correct the problems.  Every person at Dynamic has a hand in exceeding our clients' expectations, and you will play a key role in assuring our clients are fully utilizing the EDI risk adjustment module, and enjoying the full value of the solution.  Your daily work is likely to consist of:

  • Performing audits on data imported and data exported
  • Performing reconciliation on submitted records vs. received responses
  • Providing analysis for root cause and correction actions for risk adjustment customers' Voyager errors
  • Tracking and following up on risk adjustment files received, processed and submitted
  • Documenting all mapping changes or issues
  • Documenting weekly statuses, meeting minutes and clients' concerns
  • Keeping up to date on CMS changes and assisting with development of new business requirements and functional specifications as they relate to risk adjustment 

 The Ideal Candidate will bring:

  • Medicare Advantage experience at the plan level in a systems operations capacity, interfacing with both the plan and CMS
  • Three or more years of experience in Medicare risk adjustment and ANSI X12, working with Palmetto, CSSC, and CMS
  • Experience processing 5010 and 837 files
  • Advanced Data analysis in SQL
  • Interfacing with clients to gather requirements and review operational statuses
  • Excellent application troubleshooting based on data analysis
  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience is required

results.title: UX/UI Lead
results.description:
Spacewell is looking for a hands-on and experienced UX/UI Lead for our local offices in Eindhoven or Wilrijk. You will define, implement and execute our UX/UI strategy. You will do this working closely with product management, development, commercial colleagues and our (potential) customers. Together with our Product Leadership you will act as a change agent in our transformation in becoming a full product driven company with a UX-first approach. You area true motivator and are able to get our teams excited as well! Are we speaking about you? Reach out!

A day on the job

  • 8.45 AM: You arrive at the office and open your mailbox. Right away, you have a Teams call with two of your colleagues from India. During this call you make sure they are up to date with the newest information about the UX/UI strategy.
  • 10.00 AM: Afterwards, you make yourself ready to give a short training to the (junior) UX/UI Designers with tips and tricks.
  • 10.45 AM: Because you are overall responsible for the product's UX, you play an important role in our product discovery processes, you meet up with your colleagues from product management to discuss the latest requirements
  • 11 AM: Time to fill up your cup of coffee!
  • 11.30 AM: You work on a training for our product managers/owners, developers and designers for using different methods, tools and Figma.
  • Noon: Lunch time!
  • 1 PM: You are also responsible to guide our product teams incorporating UX within their way of working.
  • 14.30 PM: You start with working out a new UX/UI strategy to implement.
  • 4 PM: You work on a set of high-fidelity mockups for the user stories assigned to you. Once the framework is clear, you assign the work to one of the team members.

What about the team?

As a UX/UI Lead you get to be a part of a dynamic and warm team of international direct colleagues. They understand the challenges that come with the job, and they are there to cheer you on when needed. Besides that, your colleagues all have a different background and diverse reference frameworks. This allows you to learn a lot on the job, both in terms of hard and soft skills. Depending on your evolution, expectations and what energizes you, a career path can be developed to measure.

Could this be you?

  • You have at least 3 years of experience working as a UX/UI Designer in product organizations.
  • You have university grade education (Bachelor or Master) preferably in Design.
  • You speak English fluently.
  • You are experienced with setting up an UX/UI strategy from scratch, design thinking and tools like validation patterns, Figma etc.
  • Working in an agile environment and using Scrum is not new for you.
  • You want to grow and learn within your expertise field.
  • You can bring your innovative vision to other people and have a sense of ownership.
  • You have the capacity to guide people and merge several products into one new product portfolio.

The challenges we see in this role

  • Spacewell is a company in full transition. At times this results in organized chaos. However, we stand together as a team to make sense of what's going on and to find meaning in each situation.
  • You're willing to learn, as you will carry out a diverse range of tasks for multiple regions. By linking different pieces of information together, you're easily able to get an idea of the bigger picture and to put things into perspective.
  • You're not afraid to speak up in case you have questions. You have a sense of responsibility and ownership, so that you know when to escalate (potential) issues, when to treat information in a confidential way.

How do we make this a win-win?

  • You get to be a part of a quick, innovative, dynamic and warm team of colleagues with different backgrounds and reference frameworks.
  • Your colleagues understand your challenges,  will help you along the way and appreciate your hard work.
  • You really get the chance to make a difference and to grow together with your colleagues. Such as, for example, our own Spacewell Academy and following LinkedIn Trainings.
  • Next to the flexible work hours and remote working possibilities, you will get a salary and fringe benefits in line with your experience.

What would next steps look like?

  1. You reach out to our recruitment team to send in your CV or to ask some further questions.
  2. You will be invited for a digital cup of coffee.
  3. Depending on locations and schedules, you will meet up with your future colleagues at our offices or virtually.

results.title: Community Experience Director
results.description:
Community Experience- Community Experience Director

Full Time, Remote

Prenda is on a mission to empower learners. We help people run microschools, where small groups of kids meet, often in a home, and own their education. The model is helping light a fire for kids like Mo (https://youtu.be/g4nLjauGM3U), and we want to empower many more. Imagine a world where kids grow up as empowered learners - they choose to learn, develop their gifts, and apply their passion and grit to solve the world’s big problems!

We are looking for a Community Experience Director. This is a new role for Prenda. We tried the traditional marketing route of digital ads and sales funnels and they didn’t work. Prenda started with a community-first approach, and we’re going to reinvest deeply into community again, going back to our roots. We have been working with a community consultant (David Spinks) to design our community strategy from the ground up.

This role reports directly to the Chief Growth Officer with full visibility with the entire executive team, including the CEO/Founder Kelly Smith. You will be a part of taking our vision and making it happen through community experiments, learning, and developing roles within the community. You are someone who has successfully inspired and has been a part of building engaging communities. You understand how to build community with Prenda’s goals in mind to resolve complex issues, improve processes and find new solutions. You are regarded as an expert in your field and have strong interpersonal skills allowing you to work with internal teams and community leaders. You also understand how to translate a strategy into action and lead a team to the successful execution of the plan.

Our company is obsessed with the mission of empowering learners, we live our core values of Start with Heart, Foundation of Trust, Dare Greatly, Figure It Out, and Learning Over Comfort. We see the hearts and minds of humans as the single most important resource on Earth. All of us have unlimited capacity to solve problems, reason, inspire, create, fail, iterate, and grow. We want our community to help people understand how to help kids be active learners, leading their educational journey and teaching parents how to support them.

Prenda is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We base our employment decisions on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on these characteristics, and we encourage applicants of all ages.

Responsibilities

  • Implement Prenda’s community strategy to onboard and activate community leaders (known as “Coaches”) who recruit and support the people who run our Microschools (known as “Guides”)
  • Work with internal teams on process and continued development of the community experience team
  • Oversee digital community spaces including Mighty Networks (for existing Guides) and PrendaCon (our in-person Prenda conference)
  • Manage a remote team of 5-7 people
  • Work collaboratively with the Media team on the development of content for the community

Education/Experience/Other Requirements

  • Directly supervised one or more community professionals in a previous role
  • Experience with the development, design, testing, documentation, and analysis of new community programs
  • Experience building community focused on achieving marketing goals is a plus
  • 4-6 years of related experience preferred
  • Startup experience a plus
  • Managing remote teams a plus
  • Ability to travel required
Benefits
  • Competitive salary combined with equity ($120-$130k approximate salary range)
  • Health insurance
  • Home office set up stipend
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Entirely remote team
  • Live and work by our core values of Start with Heart, Foundation of Trust, Dare Greatly, Figure It Out, and Learning Over Comfort.

results.title: Head of Customer Experience
results.description:
Fully remote in Europe.

About Reedsy

We’re here to give authors the tools and resources they need to create beautiful books. Our marketplace gathers the industry's best publishing professionals — the likes of Neil Gaiman's editor, Nora Roberts' book marketer, and GRRM’s cover designer.

We’ve grown to a community of 1,000,000 authors and over 3,000 freelancers in just a few short years, while picking up a number of industry awards along the way 🏆

Want to hop on board and help us get to our next destination? Cool, keep reading!

Job Specification

You will lead a team of 8 across multiple time zones, defining best practices and improving our customer support processes to make them seamless. You will work closely with our engineering team to develop new features and automate our work.

Your role will involve:

  • Leading our customer support team;
  • Onboarding new agents, ensuring that they are trained in customer service skills and knowledge of Reedsy services;
  • Maintaining and updating our FAQ based on user feedback and questions;
  • Automating processes and tasks to make customer support more efficient;
  • Tracking the performance of our support team;

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience in customer support;

  •  Experience in recruitment;
  • Experience training new hires to ensure constant delivery of top-notch service;

Bonus Points

  • Previous experience working for a fast-growing startup, ideally with marketplace and/or in a creative industry;
  • Fluent in multiple languages. Reedsy welcomes applicants of all cultures and backgrounds; and
  • A good dose of ambition, a willingness to learn, and a great sense of humor.

Benefits

  • Work from home;
  • Paid paternal and maternal leave;
  • Reedski, our annual ski trip.

Salary range:

€40k – €50k

results.title: Python Developer (e-Commerce)
results.description:
Tired of hustling work in software houses? Missing the feeling of creating something real? Want to have an impact and have your opinion heard? Carry on reading.

 

eCommerce Team

In collaboration with the Product Department and Brand Marketing, this team creates content around our offer and our brand. Growth Department

 

This department was created as a result of the integration of eCommerce and Performance Marketing teams. Growth, together with the Operations Department, is responsible for guiding the user through the complete user path. The primary responsibility of Growth is to reach conversion goals. By combining those two teams we are able to create a coherent and smooth customer journey while improving the efficiency of our marketing efforts.

 

 
Main responsibilities
 
  • Work with Python 3.9, Django 3.2 and Django REST Framework 3.13 on the e-commerce side of the company
  • Develop well thought out and tested code
  • Working closely with our frontend developers
  • Design internal APIs and integrate with external ones
  • Accept and provide feedback during code reviews
  • Share knowledge and take responsibility for your work

 

Our technological stack:


Django 3.2, Python 3.9 (moving to 3.10 soon), DRF, PostgreSQL, Celery, Docker, Kubernetes

 


Why Tylko?
Being a part of the Tylko team goes beyond clocking in every day and keeping your head down. We celebrate inclusivity and work together to build a culture of happy, healthy employees who are truly heard, and provide the following great benefits for every single member:

  • One bonus day off (every month)
  • A discount on all Tylko products
  • Fully remote or Hybrid work setup (your choice)
  • Comprehensive healthcare
  • Mixer parties
  • Fun events like cooking classes, inspiring talks with people and professionals from all walks of life, and other great meetups.
  • And of course, a dog-friendly office!

You will be fairly remunerated – 15 000 – 20 000 PLN +VAT (depending on your skills and experience).
Must have
  • At least 3 years of commercial experience with creating and maintaining Django apps
  • Self-motivation and ability to work autonomously, while still being a team player
  • Experience in developing and integrating APIs
  • Experience in working with PostgreSQL
  • Good command of written and spoken English 
  • Be located in Poland
 
Nice to have
  • Experience with PyTest, CI/CD and Docker are a big plus
  • Command of Polish language

 

ABOUT TYLKO
 

TYLKO is an innovative tech-driven furniture company founded in 2015 in Warsaw, Poland. We specialize in providing high-quality storage that our customers can adapt down to the last detail through the use of an intuitive online configurator and our AR-enhanced Tylko App.

We’ve reworked every step of the traditional furniture-buying process in order to create a better and more personal experience – a seamless process from high-quality products with simple online shopping, through free doorstep delivery and effortless, tool-free assembly.

We’re a tight-knit team of 200 specialists from around the world working in the diverse fields of design, production, IT, marketing, communication, customer experience, and much more.

results.title: Lead/Senior Python Developer
results.description:
Patona works with top enterprises and digital native businesses in Australia, helping them build remote teams in India and Sri Lanka. Working with well-known market-leading brands, we pride ourselves on hiring great teams to work on exciting game-changing technology. Patona currently has 200+ engineers, testers, product managers, etc, working across 20+ partners. We focus on uplifting how organisations build and manage their remote teams through excellent working relationships, trust, integrity, culture, and hiring processes.

About the organisation you will work for.

You will be working for a company that is changing the way people search for and find the best prices for products online. Their goal is to replace google's search and google shopping as the place people currently go to do this. The founders and investors have built companies cumulatively worth billions of dollars and have significant capital backing.

Requirements

To help our client achieve their ambitious goals, we are looking for a talented Tech Lead. Your primary focus will be developing API and Event-driven services using well-known Python frameworks and other backend technologies. You will be prepared to take ownership of the overall solution you are delivering, including architecture, and work with the engineering manager and the CTO to ensure timelines are met and the overall solution is robust and easy to maintain.

You will coordinate and collaborate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the solution. Therefore, a commitment to collaboration, communication, problem-solving, sophisticated design, and quality product is important. You will work in a disruptive digital native business.

What you’ll do…

  • Technically lead the solutions you’re working on, including the architecture (with CTO) and working with the product manager/key stakeholders to ensure delivery.
  • Taking ownership and accountability is a must for the projects you're responsible for.
  • Work directly with design/product teams to design solutions.
  • Own the research for the upcoming projects and responsible for the creation of technical specifications.
  • Design REST and GraphQL APIs
  • Develop efficient, scalable, and robust Python code.
  • Review and recommend improvements to solutions and code.
  • Review code of other developers and coach them on best practice coding standards.
  • Ongoing performance monitoring and optimisation of systems owned.
  • Participate in Sprints to develop increments of work, including estimation of effort for stories.

What you must bring…

  • Disciplined self-starter, capable of working independently and in close collaboration in a remote environment.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate issues to technical and non-technical audiences and clearly document developed solutions.
  • At least 5 years of experience in creating API and Event-driven services for high-traffic / high-throughput systems.
  • At least 2 years of experience in designing and developing APIs with Python.
  • At least 2 years of experience with data modelling and optimisation for a relational database (MySQL or Postgres).
  • Experienced in building a commercial (live) solution that serves at least 1 million users/month.

What’s great to have…

What’s good to have…

  • GraphQL API design and development.
  • CI and CD implementation with Github Actions.
  • Understanding of Micro Services Architecture.

Benefits

  • Private Health for you and your family.
  • Work remotely or in any of our offices across India (WeWork offices).

results.title: Senior Software Engineer - Rails
results.description:
About Aumni

Aumni is an investment analytics company based in Salt Lake City, Utah. At Aumni, we are creating an automated platform to extract information directly from venture capital deals and provide the most comprehensive strategic insights related to the economic and legal details in each investment. About the Role

We are looking for a strong mid-level Rails engineer to help us continue to build out our core functionality. Your primary focus will be the back-end development of new features for venture capitalists.

In addition, you will be expected to help keep our application performant and well-architected so that our code is maintainable, consistent, and readable for new developers. We are big believers in quality code, code linters, testing, and code reviews.

Aumni is a Ruby on Rails backend with a React front end.

This position is for Salt Lake City (Cottonwood Heights), UT or 100% remote.

Experience
  • 5+ Years of Rails and Postgres experience
  • 1+ year of React experience preferred
  • Side projects that you're happy to show off

Bonus points if familiar with any of the following:

  • Open source contributions
  • Ransack experience
  • Service Object experience

Benefits
  • Competitive base salary and stock options to ensure that everyone is personally invested in the success of the company
  • Provided desk setup including MacBook, monitors, keyboard, and mouse/trackpad
  • Employer-sponsored health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Employer-sponsored mental and physical health programs
  • Flexible PTO policy that advocates for a strong work-life balance

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
Company Description

Work smart, have fun and make an impact!

Our purpose is to guide all companies toward a sustainable world. EcoVadis is the leading provider of business sustainability ratings. Our solutions are backed by an international team of experts and powerful technology. We analyze data and build sustainability scorecards that give companies actionable insights into their environmental, social and ethical risks.

Why apply to EcoVadis? Be a part of the global sustainability change in business. Grow your career. Work with extraordinary people. Feel valued for your contribution.

Learn more about our team and culture on EcoVadis careers page. If you have questions about the company or open roles you can chat with an insider.



Job Description

Our Product Management team is seeking an experienced Product Manager to help scale our applications and to fuel our expansion. In this role, you will report to the Group Product Manager and participate in the evolution and creation of products and features within our EcoVadis Product Suite from conception to launch.

In this role you will: 

  • Own the integration of EcoVadis data and workflows into third-party customer tools like ERP and SRM systems, as well as partner platforms and be responsible for driving product evolution and innovation;
  • Participate in overall product strategy, including researching and developing requirements for existing products;
  • Elicit business requirements for current and future product functionalities by participating in user research supported by direct contact with users;
  • Work closely with customers and stakeholders and cross-functional teams;
  • Work closely with developing team: Designers, Engineers, SME;
  • Participate in defining and analyzing qualitative and quantitative data that drives the success of our products;
  • Bring insights from our product’s data and analytics to inform decision-making.



Qualifications
  • Minimum 3+ years of Product Management experience at a software company;
  • Experience with enterprise resource planning software and designing and building integrations with these tools;
  • You are familiar with Agile methodologies and have an understanding of modern web/SaaS technologies and systems;
  • You communicate effectively and can act as the liaison between various stakeholders in the business including design and technical teams;
  • You show curiosity and possesses an appreciation for thinking outside the box;
  • You have experience and passion for designing an engaging user experience;
  • English at full professional proficiency level (an additional European language is a strong advantage);
  • Relevant university degree



Additional Information

Location: Warsaw/Remote from Poland
Start date: ASAP
Contract: B2B or CoE

Everyone at EcoVadis contributes to a culture of trust, respect and empowerment. Our growing team in Poland is full of talented professionals from various sectors who all share a desire to make an impact. We offer competitive salaries and support personal growth from day one with extensive onboarding, mentoring and a brand new e-learning platform bursting with courses and modules so you can learn new skills and fine-tune old ones.

Benefits:
• Support with all the necessary office and IT equipment
• Optional (fully covered or co-financed) health care and life insurance
• Multisport card and wellness allowance
• Multicafeteria
• Lunch card
• Annual performance bonus
• Flexible working hours
• Hybrid/ full remote work
• Remote work from abroad policy
• French and Polish classes
• Internet and Electricity bill allowance
• CSR activities
• Modern, pet-friendly office in the city center (next to Rondo ONZ)
• Community service day when volunteering

Our hiring team looks forward to reviewing your CV, in English, with a guaranteed response to every application. A new job with purpose awaits you!

Don’t fit all the criteria but still think you’d be a good candidate? Please apply anyway to give our hiring team the opportunity to assess your skills and to learn more about what you could bring to EcoVadis. We’re interested in hiring capable people, regardless of professional and educational background.

Can the hiring process be adjusted to suit my needs? Yes. We want everyone going through the hiring process with EcoVadis to feel confident that you are able to demonstrate your full potential. We welcome applications from disabled people, people with long-term health conditions, and neurodiverse candidates. If you need any adjustments, including the provision of interview questions, please let the hiring team know.

Our team’s strength comes from everyone’s uniqueness and is founded upon mutual respect. EcoVadis commits to equity, inclusion and reducing bias in our hiring processes. EcoVadis does not accept any form of discrimination based on color, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, citizenship, religion, beliefs, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, parental status, or any other protected characteristic that makes you unique. In your application, we encourage you to remove personal information such as: photographs, marital status, number of children, religion, gender, residential postal code, university graduation date, past medical or parental leave(s) taken, nationality (instead, please state if you are legally eligible to work in the job region/country), university name (instead, please state any degrees obtained and the study major).

results.title: Product Manager - Services
results.description:
Company Description

Would you like to join one of the largest providers of communications and IT solutions across the UK as a Product Manager for our services offerings?

Since being founded in 2001, Daisy delivers solutions and services serving more 2,000 UK businesses across all sectors – with a portfolio spanning Modern Workplace, Connectivity, Unified Communications, Cloud, Cyber Security and Operational Resilience.



Job Description

About this role...

Services include both maintenance and management services in support of Daisy’s technical solution areas.

The applicant will be responsible for full lifecycle management of an existing product portfolio as well as introducing new products working alongside the product tower lead(s).The role will introduce, manage and monitor the product(s) in life. The success of the role will be dependent on working in virtual teams and influencing key stakeholders from around the business.

The role will be primarily internal facing with external facing responsibilities on occasion.  In general, providing assistance to the sales community is a vital part of the position.

The role will incorporate vendor and supplier relationships. The successful applicant will be the DCS lead for the relationship with vendors that support the product area.

 

Responsibilities

·        At all times working toward making the product & services portfolio ‘Easy to buy and easy to sell’

·        Identification and introduction of new product / capabilities to be offered

·        Manage products in life to track service value to the customer and Daisy

·        Follow Daisy’s Portfolio Management processes

·        Input into the creation of cost models and pricing tools

·        Leading virtual teams to deliver product activity such as on boarding new products or propositions

·        Stakeholder engagement

·        Reporting on product portfolio

·        Input into product roadmaps

·        Implementation of and collaboration on best practice for lifecycle management

·        Business improvement

·        Creation of business plans / business cases to support training and investment in new capabilities

  • To liaise with manufacturers for technical updates and support for the technologies used
  • Vendor management including but not exclusive to, monthly meetings, sales tracking, business plan creation
  • Travelling between different Daisy and vendor premises in order to efficiently conduct business
  • Working as part of a virtual go to market team alongside colleagues in sales, marketing, commercial and operations



Qualifications

What do we need from you?

  • Knowledge, Skills, Experience

    -        Knowledge of IT Services including maintenance, support and management and the differences therein - Essential

    -        Ability to work in virtual geographically dispersed teams - Essential

    -        ITIL Certification – Desired

    -        Experience in product lifecycle management – Desired

    -        To be technically and commercially aware of the market and have a full understanding of the technical, business and commercial propositions on offer

    -        Knowledge of Sales/Operational processes and their interaction with the Project Delivery Teams

    -        Strong organisational and interpersonal skills

    -        Good time management skills

    -        Strong attention to detail and diligence

    -        Excellent written skills

    -        Ability to assess urgency and quickly reorganise workloads according to priority

    -        Good oral and communication skills with the ability to articulate a message to a mixed audience, from managerial/strategic personnel to technical personnel



Additional Information

Did we mention the perks?

We show our appreciation by providing various benefits and rewards to our employees that help make Daisy a great place to work and provide a great work life balance.

These include but are not limited to:

  • Holiday – Starting at 25 (increasing to up to 30 days for each year you stay with us) + a holiday purchase scheme!
  • Daisy University and Apprenticeships – Giving you the opportunity to expand your skills and knowledge whilst you work for us.
  • Hybrid, field and home based working – To ensure work WORKS for you.
  • Enhanced family friendly policies – We are here to look after you and your nearest and dearest.
  • Health & Wellbeing offering – Including discounted membership for health plans + Eye Care Scheme, Employee Assistance Programme, and an in-house Wellbeing team.
  • The Exchange – Online discount platform for more than 1,200 retailers.

And many more – to see all the benefits on offer visit our Why work for Daisy page!

Ready to join us?

If you feel Daisy is the right workplace for you, we would like to hear from you!

Once you have applied online and have been shortlisted, our recruitment team will be in touch with you to arrange an interview and answer any questions you may have. This could be a face-to-face or a remote interview. The application process varies depending on the role and the level of experience needed.

results.title: DriveBid Sales Executive
results.description:
Company Description

DriveBid, a division of DrivenIQ, is the only live trade-in marketplace where dealers compete to buy your vehicle. DriveBid connects consumers who want the best offer for their trade-in with dealers who need inventory in a real-time, easy-to-use online platform. Dealers configure criteria for the vehicles they need and compete with live bids or make cash offers for vehicles that match these criteria. Consumers launch their trades in an open competitive platform, communicate with dealers and get offers for their trades, all in real-time. 

DriveBid simultaneously captures key vehicle and consumer data to help dealers make smart vehicle buying and inventory management decisions in the future. Our team has 30+ years of experience in the auto industry.



Job Description

What you’ll do:

We're looking for a remote employee to work out of the state of Michigan.  As a DriveBid Sales Executive, you will be responsible for creating, building and promoting brand awareness in an assigned territory for the DriveBid brand. You will also be responsible for generating new sales business and maximizing transaction with both dealerships and consumers.

Your weekly goals: Identify new prospect opportunities with dealers and events to attend to promote awareness to consumers. Present demonstrations on the DriveBid product, present cost and sign-up retailers. Help auto dealers find and buy more used car trades and help consumers sell their car more efficiently for the most competitive offer. You’ll become the primary point of contact when a client signs up for our program and will work closely with the customer support team to retain that business.

Your role will be to establish trust with all our customers in your portfolio and show the value of the DriveBid solutions to make them partners not just customers for life. 



Qualifications

What you’ll need:

To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to individuals with medical conditions to perform the essential functions.

  • BS/BA in Marketing, Business Administration, or another related field preferred but not required
  • 4-5+ years of car sales, internet sales or business development sales experience; used car sales preferred
  • Track record of successfully achieving monthly sales or new prospect goals
  • A deep understanding of the retail automotive landscape, new cars vs used car sales, CRMs, and how dealers’ business units operate & market
  • Digital marketing and automotive advertising experience a plus
  • Experience working with used car trade platforms preferred; KAR Global, Carvana, AutoTrader
  • Experience working sales by phone and virtual meetings using Zoom, Teams, Webex
  • This position is remote, so you will be expected to be a self-starter, and provide detailed activity and performance of your daily results in Salesforce, etc.
  • Independent problem-solving skills and adaptivity to change
  • You’re a people-person! You love talking to people and building lasting relationships
  • Know how to communicate strategies to show value in products
  • Ability to build solid relationships, provide excellent customer service, and create the consultative environment
  • Strong collaboration & teamwork skills. You’ll need to partner closely with your team and your clients
  • You can easily manage multiple tasks in a well-organized and highly detailed manner while working in a fast-paced, perpetually evolving, relationship-driven environment
  • Stay up to date with automotive industry trends
  • Travel will be required to dealers three days a week and to events
  • Other duties may be assigned by supervisor


Additional Information

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Pay
  • Holidays + Unlimited PTO. It’s all about balance and we trust you will get your work done!
  • Medical, Dental, Vision plans available
  • Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Plans, Company Sponsored
  • Complimentary $25k Basic Life Insurance and AD&D
  • Learning and growth opportunities
  • Remote work - work comfortably from your home

This job advertisement in no way states or implies that these are the only duties and responsibilities to be performed by this employee. A full job description will be provided if and when a job offer is presented. The employee will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties and responsibilities upon the request of a supervisor.

DriveBid is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

results.title: Performance Marketing Manager

results.title: Senior Software Engineer, Assessment Platform
results.description:
The Role

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer who wants to be an impactful part of a small team looking to change the way technical hiring is done. In this role, you will be an integral part of our Assessment Platform Engineering team.

The Assessment Platform team forms a bridge between the interview content powering CodeSignal's Skills Evaluation Frameworks and the Pre-Screen, Tech Screen, and Interview products that delight our customers. Engineers in Assessment Platform interact frequently with Product Engineers and Technical Assessment Developers throughout the organization, and work on parts of the codebase that encompass both content creation and user interaction with the platform.

The Company

CodeSignal is the leading technical interview and assessment solution, helping companies identify the right candidates with the right skills—even if they don’t have the “right” profile. Hiring and selection teams use CodeSignal to increase speed-to-hire and candidate pipeline yield, and tap into underrepresented pools of candidates. Founded in 2014, CodeSignal is trusted by leading companies like Netflix, Capital One, Robinhood, and Dropbox. Some of our recent accomplishments include:
  • Becoming an Industry Leader in G2's Technical Screening Software Category, 2022
  • Winning BuiltIn Best Places to Work: Small Companies in SF 2022 award
  • Getting Certified as a Best Place to Work 2021-2022
  • Raising $50M in our Series C led by Index Ventures in 2021
  • Raising $25M in our Series B led by Menlo Ventures in late 2020
  • Coming in at #3 on SaaS Mag’s “SaaS 1000” list in 2020

What makes a Signalite?

Signalites are the incredible people who make up CodeSignal’s global team. We believe every Signalite should be given the context to understand decisions, the freedom to act independently, and the responsibility to do what’s right. These principles build upon each other to drive motivation, speed, innovation, and a results-oriented, high-performing culture. We believe that culture is not just about principles, but also behaviors. This belief can be seen and felt in everything we do as Signalites.

Day-to-Day 

  • Lead design discussions where you're able to lend your technical expertise
  • Brainstorm ideas to address various open-ended questions that the Assessment Platform (and the company as a whole) is tackling
  • Build, oversee, and improve workflows to validate the correctness of interview content, import it to the CodeSignal platform, and ensure display fidelity
  • Develop tools to maintain the high quality and fairness of our assessment frameworks, share insights discovered with the help of these tools with relevant teams within the company

Basic Qualifications

  • At least 4 years of professional, full-time software engineering experience
  • Clear and effective communication skills
  • Drive and initiative for getting things done
  • Available to work full-time. If remote, some timezone overlap during regular business hours with our San Francisco and Yerevan based teams is required.

Bonus Points for the Following

  • Experience with mid to large-scale projects in TypeScript and/or Python

Why You’ll Love It Here

  • 💰 Competitive salaries based on local market, and 401(k) match for U.S. based-employees

  • 🩺  Medical, dental, and vision insurance

  • 🥳  Team activities and get-togethers to connect with your fellow Signalites

  • 🏝  Unlimited PTO and remote-first work policy

  • 📚  Continuous learning with educational reimbursements provided

  • 💻  Equipment provision and generous home office setup stipend

  • 💙 A challenging and fulfilling opportunity to join a fast-growing SaaS company

We know that great work comes from great, and inclusive teams. At CodeSignal, we specifically look for individuals of varying strengths, skills, backgrounds, and ideas. We believe this gives us a competitive advantage to better serve our customers and helps us all grow as Signalites and individuals. We hire candidates of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital or family status, disability, Veteran status, and any other status. CodeSignal is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Salary Projection

In accordance with local regulations in jurisdictions where CodeSignal may hire, we are projecting an annual base salary in the range of USD$100,000-250,000. This range is based on San Francisco benchmarks and encompasses all seniority levels eligible for this position. Offer packages often contain additional compensation in the form of commission or performance bonuses, equity, and/or benefits. Offers are awarded on an individual basis and are subject to factors such as, without limitation, a candidate’s level of experience, growth trajectory, and local labor market. Employees' compensation is reviewed and adjusted regularly.

results.title: Crypto Treasury Manager

  • Strong written and spoken English.
